9fbd67bb-4ec5-4785-b18a-c64487d89436.description: Faculty members will demonstrate a commitment to Justice, Equity, Diversity and Inclusion (JEDI) in their teaching, providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for all students and a recognition of the contributions of traditionally marginalized communities.

alignments.name: Essential Competencies for Teaching Online
alignments.description: A new set of online course design and delivery standards developed by Union Institute and University (UI&U). The seven Essential Competencies for Teaching Online (ECTO) are a set of critical skills that all UI&U faculty are expected to master.

badge_template_activities.title: The ability to design an online course for accessibility and inclusion.
The ability to consistently demonstrate that diversity is valued through the course content and learning activities.
The ability to populate the course with visual resources that reflect a multicultural world.
The ability to design course content and course learning activities so that human biases are identified.

49c89658-b022-4386-b686-3ee1d664f49f.description: To earn this credential participants will design assignments for online courses that are deliberate, authentic and build student skills as well as knowledge. ECTO 002: Assignment Design, is one of the university's seven Essential Competencies for Teaching Online (ECTO) modules. The ECTO modules Identify a set of online teaching competencies that every Union Institute and University (UI&U) professor should own.

issuer.summary: issued by Union Institute and University

alignments.name: Essential Competencies for Teaching Online (ECTO)
alignments.description: Essential Competencies for Teaching Online are new set of online course design and delivery standards developed by Union Institute and University (UI&U). The seven Essential Competencies for Teaching Online (ECTO) are a set of critical skills that all UI&U faculty will be expected to master.

badge_template_activities.title: The ability to craft assignments that deliberately build critical thinking skills in the field.
The ability to craft authentic and creative assignments by applying content to real world situations.

Familiarity with best practice standards for assignment design prompts: a. Indicate the overarching purpose of each assignment b. Provide clear and detailed instructions c. Provide criteria for success.
Purposefully integrate the use of Library and other internal/external resources into the assignments themselves.
The ability to create long and complex assignments through scaffolding.
